detailed_issues.red_flag: The resolution should specify the scope and limitations of the authorized person's powers. Consider adding a clause limiting the authorized person to actions directly related to the incorporation process.
detailed_issues.suggestion: Add a clause clarifying that the authorized person's actions are limited to those directly related to the incorporation process and in compliance with ADGM regulations.

detailed_issues.suggestion: Remove this section from the final board resolution document.
detailed_issues.section_text: Table 1: SAMPLE & GUIDANCE | SAMPLE & GUIDANCE; Title: | Resolution of Multiple Individual Shareholders for incorporation of Public Company Limited by...

detailed_issues.red_flag: It should be explicitly stated that the Articles of Association comply with the ADGM Companies Regulations 2020.
detailed_issues.suggestion: Add a clause stating that the Articles of Association comply with the ADGM Companies Regulations 2020.
detailed_issues.section_text: IT WAS RESOLVED that the Company adopts the Articles of Association for the purpose of incorporation of the Company in the Abu Dhabi Global Market.

detailed_issues.red_flag: The resolution should specify the currency and breakdown of the authorized share capital (e.g., number of shares and par value).
detailed_issues.suggestion: Provide a detailed breakdown of the authorized share capital, including the number of shares and par value per share.
detailed_issues.section_text: IT WAS RESOLVED that the amount of the authorised share capital of the company shall be as follows: [xxxx] USD

detailed_issues.red_flag: This section is a table format, and it's unclear if the table is populated with actual shareholder information. If it is, ensure all information is accurate and complete.
detailed_issues.suggestion: Ensure the table is populated with accurate and complete shareholder information, including full names, share class, number of shares, amount paid, and any unpaid amounts.
detailed_issues.section_text: Table 6: Shareholder’s Name | Share Class Name | Number of Issued Shares | Amount paid | Amount unpaid (if any)

detailed_issues.red_flag: This section is just a title and lacks substantive content. It should be integrated with other sections or expanded upon.
detailed_issues.suggestion: Integrate this title with the relevant sections of the resolution or expand upon it to provide more context.
detailed_issues.section_text: RESOLUTION OF INCORPORATING SHAREHOLDERS

detailed_issues.red_flag: The resolution should specify the full names and titles of the appointed officers. It should also state that the appointments are subject to ADGM regulatory requirements.
detailed_issues.suggestion: Provide the full names and titles of the appointed officers and state that the appointments are subject to ADGM regulatory requirements and approval.
detailed_issues.section_text: IT WAS RESOLVED, to appoint the officers of the company upon incorporation as follows.

detailed_issues.red_flag: The resolution should explicitly state the powers granted to the authorised signatory(ies) and the scope of their authority. Missing details could lead to ambiguity and potential misuse of authority.
detailed_issues.suggestion: Specify the exact powers delegated to the authorised signatory(ies), including transaction limits, reporting requirements, and any restrictions on their authority.
detailed_issues.section_text: Appointment of Authorised Signatory(ies)

detailed_issues.red_flag: The resolution should specify the currency of the issued share capital. Omitting this detail can lead to confusion and potential disputes.
detailed_issues.suggestion: Clearly state the currency (e.g., USD, AED) in which the issued share capital is denominated.
detailed_issues.section_text: IT WAS RESOLVED that the proposed issued share capital of the company shall be as follows:

detailed_issues.red_flag: The resolution should detail the types of shares (e.g., ordinary, preference) and the rights attached to each class of shares. Lack of clarity can lead to shareholder disputes.
detailed_issues.suggestion: Specify the number of shares in each class, the par value (if any), and the voting, dividend, and liquidation rights associated with each class of shares.
detailed_issues.section_text: The issued share capital shall be structured as follows.

detailed_issues.red_flag: The resolution should clearly state the specific actions the signatory is authorised to perform for incorporation purposes. Vague language can lead to uncertainty.
detailed_issues.suggestion: Specify the exact documents the signatory is authorised to sign, the authorities they are authorised to interact with, and any limitations on their authority.
detailed_issues.section_text: Appointment of Signatory for Incorporation Purposes

detailed_issues.red_flag: The resolution should include a statement confirming that the shareholders agree to subscribe for the shares as outlined in the resolution. This is a standard corporate governance practice.
detailed_issues.suggestion: Add a clause stating that the shareholders acknowledge and agree to subscribe for the shares as detailed in the resolution.
detailed_issues.section_text: Signature of Incorporating Shareholders

detailed_issues.red_flag: No issues found
detailed_issues.suggestion: Document appears compliant
detailed_issues.section_text: Table 7: Shareholder’s Name | Shareholder’s Signature | Date

detailed_issues.red_flag: No issues found
detailed_issues.suggestion: Document appears compliant
detailed_issues.section_text: [Insert proposed company name]

detailed_issues.red_flag: The resolution should specify the scope of the signing authority (e.g., financial transactions, legal documents) and any limitations. Missing details can lead to ambiguity.
detailed_issues.suggestion: Clearly define the types of documents or transactions each signatory is authorised to sign, and any monetary or other limits on their authority.
detailed_issues.section_text: Table 2: Name | Signing Authority (Jointly/Severally)

detailed_issues.red_flag: Missing context. Table 3's purpose is unclear. It's impossible to determine compliance without knowing what this table represents. It could be related to directors, shareholders, or other relevant parties. The 'Type' column suggests it's identifying the nature of the entity (Individual or Body Corporate), which is relevant for shareholder or director identification.
detailed_issues.law_citation: ADGM Companies Regulations 2020, Schedule 1 (Information required for incorporation)
detailed_issues.suggestion: Clarify the purpose of Table 3. If it relates to shareholders or directors, ensure all required information as per ADGM Companies Regulations 2020, Schedule 1 is included (e.g., full name, address, nationality, date of birth for individuals; registered name, registered office address, registration number for body corporates).
detailed_issues.section_text: Table 3: Name | Type (Individual/Body Corporate)

detailed_issues.red_flag: Missing context. Table 4's purpose is unclear. The 'Capacity' column (Jointly/Severally) suggests it relates to individuals acting together, possibly as shareholders or authorized signatories. Without knowing the context, compliance cannot be determined.
detailed_issues.law_citation: ADGM Companies Regulations 2020, Articles 64-66 (Authority of Directors and Delegation)
detailed_issues.suggestion: Clarify the purpose of Table 4. If it relates to authorized signatories, ensure the resolution clearly defines the scope of their authority and any limitations. If it relates to joint shareholders, ensure compliance with regulations regarding joint ownership and voting rights.
detailed_issues.section_text: Table 4: Name | Capacity (Jointly/Severally)

detailed_issues.red_flag: Incomplete information. While the table outlines share class details, it lacks crucial information such as the currency of the nominal value and amount of issued shares. Also, the rights attached to each share class are not specified. This is essential for compliance.
detailed_issues.law_citation: ADGM Companies Regulations 2020, Article 52 (Rights attached to shares)
detailed_issues.suggestion: Specify the currency for the nominal value and amount of issued shares. Include a separate section or table detailing the rights, privileges, restrictions, and conditions attached to each share class (e.g., voting rights, dividend rights, liquidation preferences).
detailed_issues.section_text: Table 5: Share Class Name | Nominal Value | Number of Issued Shares | Amount of Issued Shares

detailed_issues.red_flag: Document may be missing explicit ADGM jurisdiction clause
detailed_issues.suggestion: Add clause: 'This document shall be governed by ADGM law and subject to ADGM Courts jurisdiction'

detailed_issues.red_flag: The resolution references "Abu Dhabi Global Market" but does not explicitly state that the company is organized under ADGM laws and subject to ADGM Courts jurisdiction. This is a critical omission.
detailed_issues.law_citation: ADGM Registration and Incorporation; ADGM Companies Regulations 2020, Articles 16-25
detailed_issues.suggestion: The resolution should explicitly state that the company is organized and existing under the laws of Abu Dhabi Global Market and subject to the ADGM Courts jurisdiction. The Articles of Association must also specify ADGM jurisdiction.
detailed_issues.compliant_clause: RESOLVED, that the draft articles of association annexed to this resolution be adopted as the articles of association of the Company, which is organized and existing under the laws of Abu Dhabi Global Market and subject to the ADGM Courts jurisdiction, in substitution for, and to the exclusion of, the Company’s existing articles of association.

Schedule board/shareholder meetings for required resolutions
